intro: Lipochaeta lavarum var. stearnsii, commonly known as the narrowleaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers, which bloom during the spring and summer months. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal dunes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
